content:
• Monday, August 22, 2011
  • FMCN

    Chinese digital-advertising company Focus Media Holding (NASDAQ:FMCN) Q2 earnings climbed 69%,...

    Chinese digital-advertising company Focus Media Holding (NASDAQ:FMCN) Q2 earnings climbed 69%, helped by a recovery in advertising and better management of its revenue seasonality. The company also makes positive comments on its H2, saying it's on track to roll out its next-generation LCD advertising screens in seven cities. Shares +6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES) reports FQ4 revenues largely in-line with estimates, but raises...

    Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES) reports FQ4 revenues largely in-line with estimates, but raises its FY11 guidance as operating margins improve slightly on inventory reductions. Separately, the company announces a 45M share buyback. Shares +3.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • RP

    RealPage (NASDAQ:RP) says it's buying Internet listing service Multifamily Technology Solutions...

    RealPage (NASDAQ:RP) says it's buying Internet listing service Multifamily Technology Solutions for approximately $74M. As a result, it's reducing EPS guidance for Q3, now saying EPS will be around $0.09 versus a consensus view of of $0.11 per share. Shares -6.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • SPGI

    A pair of institutional shareholders call for breaking up McGraw-Hill (MHP) - splitting...

    A pair of institutional shareholders call for breaking up McGraw-Hill (MHP) - splitting education, information and media businesses off from Standard & Poor's ratings, which they say needs a "well-known independent oversight figure" to help improve relations with regulators and the public amid U.S. downgrade fallout. MHP was exploring an education spinoff; shares +0.9% AH. (SEC filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANRZQ

    Coal producer Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) announces a $600M share buyback. Shares +1.9% AH.

    Coal producer Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) announces a $600M share buyback. Shares +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining Corp. (NEM +4.6%) finished the day with solid gains after Citigroup upgraded the...

    Newmont Mining Corp. (NEM +4.6%) finished the day with solid gains after Citigroup upgraded the shares to buy earlier today on expectations that gold prices will continue to rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUY

    With gold rising 2.5% to $1,899/oz, it's no surprise gold stocks were among the day's big...

    With gold rising 2.5% to $1,899/oz, it's no surprise gold stocks were among the day's big winners. AUY +3.5%. ABX +2.4%. GG +4.8%. NEM 4.3%. HMY +8.2%. GFI +3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • BIRT

    Actuate (BIRT +7%) holds on to gains after being upgraded to overweight at First Analysis. The...

    Actuate (BIRT +7%) holds on to gains after being upgraded to overweight at First Analysis. The firm says the company is benefiting from its global business exposure, particularly in India, where 40% of developers are currently using or planning to use the company's technology over the next 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • P

    Shares of Pandora (P -6.2%) recover a bit after being down 10% in early afternoon trading....

    Shares of Pandora (P -6.2%) recover a bit after being down 10% in early afternoon trading. Competitors to the firm's online music service seem to continue to emerge every week, while rival Spotify is reported to have already added 1.5M paying subscibers after its recent launch in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS -3.1%) is selling off in the wake of news of CEO Blankfein's retention of a...

    Goldman Sachs (GS -3.1%) is selling off in the wake of news of CEO Blankfein's retention of a criminal attorney.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.5%) posts a gain as it strengthens its foothold as a leading online source...

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.5%) posts a gain as it strengthens its foothold as a leading online source in a hobby growing in popularity. The company looks to continue to gain site loyalty and stickiness, a tricky proposition in the online space.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • AAN

    Companies specializing in renting electronics are gaining favor, as investors see a consumer...

    Companies specializing in renting electronics are gaining favor, as investors see a consumer shift away from big-ticket electronic purchases. Shares of Aaron's (AAN +4.5%), hhgregg (HGG +3.5%) and Rent-A-Center (RCII +2.3%) are all posting healthy gains for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • ONB

    Old National Bancorp (ONB +3%) is higher today after Sandler O'Neill ups it to buy, saying it...

    Old National Bancorp (ONB +3%) is higher today after Sandler O'Neill ups it to buy, saying it likes the company's low-risk profile, good capital base and the value added from its Integra Bank deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +1.9%) shot higher around 12:45, apparently on a new rumor about Qualcomm...

    InterDigital (IDCC +1.9%) shot higher around 12:45, apparently on a new rumor about Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) weighing an offer. Tiernan Ray is skeptical Qualcomm would be interested, though if InterDigital's patents allow Qualcomm to up its 4G royalty rate from 3.25% to the 5-6% rate it often charges for 3G devices, an offer could be worth it. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • SOL

    Another case of buyback fatigue: after jumping nearly 14% following the announcement of a $100M...

    Another case of buyback fatigue: after jumping nearly 14% following the announcement of a $100M stock repurchase this morning, ReneSola (SOL +2%) has trended lower all day, giving back most of its gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • SAFM

    Sanderson Farms (SAFM -3%) trades lower today, following a downbeat article in Barron's over the...

    Sanderson Farms (SAFM -3%) trades lower today, following a downbeat article in Barron's over the weekend that says the stock could drop as much as 25% during the next 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT), a provider of mobile advertising services, is down 11.8%. Investors could be...

    Velti (VELT), a provider of mobile advertising services, is down 11.8%. Investors could be worried about recent reports of weak European mobile phone demand, given that Velti generates over 60% of its revenue from the continent.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM

  • The market's fear gauge is still flashing red hot with the VIX standing at an elevated reading...

    The market's fear gauge is still flashing red hot with the VIX standing at an elevated reading of 41.9, compared to just 15 at the beginning of July. In a sign of pervasive bearish sentiment, one buyer stepped in to purchase 10,000 September 60 calls on the VIX option.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical Corp. (WLK +1.4%) trades higher today after raising its dividend by 16% and...

    Westlake Chemical Corp. (WLK +1.4%) trades higher today after raising its dividend by 16% and announcing a $100M stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • HBI

    Apparel companies with a focus on sportier lines are moving higher in tandem today, helped along...

    Apparel companies with a focus on sportier lines are moving higher in tandem today, helped along in part from a trend in lower cotton prices. Gainers: Hanesbrand (HBI +4.4%), Warnaco Group (WRC +4.3%) and Phillips-Van Heusen (PVH +4.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • MTG

    After an initial pop at the open, shares MGIC Investment (NYSE:MTG) have reversed course, now...

    After an initial pop at the open, shares MGIC Investment (NYSE:MTG) have reversed course, now trading -7.8%. The mortgage insurer had gained earlier on news that its competitor, PMI Group (PMI -27%), was forced to closed down two of its units in Arizona, but the stock quickly succumbed to selling pressure along with the rest of its rivals: Radian (RDN -4%), Genworth Financial (GNW -0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT +1.9%) scores some attention after Scotia Capital upgrades to Outperform from Sector...

    Potash (POT +1.9%) scores some attention after Scotia Capital upgrades to Outperform from Sector Perform telling investors to "aggressively" add to their holdings, and Bof A places a Buy rating on shares with a $74 PT on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • CMP

    Compass Minerals (CMP -2%) trades lower after its Ontario salt mine and evaporation plant were...

    Compass Minerals (CMP -2%) trades lower after its Ontario salt mine and evaporation plant were damaged by a severe storm over the weekend. While there was no impairment to its underground operations, it's surface buildings sustained significant damage that will halt operations until repairs are made.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • ASYS

    Amtech Systems (ASYS -3.5%) may be suffering from a bit of "buyback fatigue" this morning,...

    Amtech Systems (ASYS -3.5%) may be suffering from a bit of "buyback fatigue" this morning, popping at the open after its board approves a plan to repurchase around $5M in common shares, only to sell-off with the broader market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • PII

    Robert W. Baird ups its ratings on two snowmobile manufacturers ahead of the winter season,...

    Robert W. Baird ups its ratings on two snowmobile manufacturers ahead of the winter season, raising Arctic Cat (ACAT +4.7%) and Polaris Industries (PII +0.7%) to outperform (I, II). Baird says both companies have high-quality products, lean inventories and "sound" balance sheets, which gives them a competitive advantage.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF) gains 5.1% after announcing Dennis Kelleher as its new CFO, an oil...

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF) gains 5.1% after announcing Dennis Kelleher as its new CFO, an oil industry veteran hired away from BP. Shares of CF now trade just a hair off of their 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • LEAF

    Shares of Demand Media (DMD +7.7%) soar after the firm announces a $25M share repurchasement...

    Shares of Demand Media (DMD +7.7%) soar after the firm announces a $25M share repurchasement program, joining earlier buybacks (I, II) from Lowe's (LOW +1.3%) and Travelzoo (TZOO +3.8%) that buoyed their shares. NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) also announced a buyback, but didn't catch the wave - shares are down 1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • RAVN

    Raven Industries (RAVN +5%) jumps as its record Q2 earnings easily beat estimates. EPS came in...

    Raven Industries (RAVN +5%) jumps as its record Q2 earnings easily beat estimates. EPS came in at $0.68 on sales of $90M, topping consensus expectations for $0.51 per share on $84M in sales as the booming commodities markets continue to drive demand for the company's precision agriculture solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • UAL

    After nearly a 6% jump higher at the open on reports that Libya's six-month war was near an end,...

    After nearly a 6% jump higher at the open on reports that Libya's six-month war was near an end, airline stocks have tapered off with the overall market: United Continental (UAL -0.6%), AMR Corp. (AMR +1.4%), Delta (DAL +1.1%), Southwest (LUV +1%), JetBlue (JBLU -2.1%), U.S. Airways (LCC +0.6%), Republic Airways (RJET -1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • BAC

    The slide in Bank of America (BAC -6.1%) continues, now trading at $6.55. Low print in this bear...

    The slide in Bank of America (BAC -6.1%) continues, now trading at $6.55. Low print in this bear market: $6.31. Low close: $6.51. Other banking shares have given up sharp early gains, but remain slightly higher to moderately lower. XLF -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -2.5%) spikes lower after the firm announces it has received...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -2.5%) spikes lower after the firm announces it has received approval from Health Canada for its liver disease tablets. Shares were initially up 3% after the opening, before taking a nosedive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    Following Friday's bloodbath, which was accompanied by six analyst downgrades, H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is...

    Following Friday's bloodbath, which was accompanied by six analyst downgrades, H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is up 3.9% today as Auriga's Kevin Hunt upgrades shares to Buy. Hunt's target of $32 is the weighted average of three potential outcomes for H-P, including a "base case" scenario resulting in a valuation of $38/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +6.6%) jump after catching an upgrade from Capstone and a Buy...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +6.6%) jump after catching an upgrade from Capstone and a Buy initiation from Canaccord on the strength of its cotton apparel products. Also gaining are Dick's Sporting Good (DKS +4.9%), Foot Locker (FL +2.1%) and Nike (NKE +1.7%), retailers where UA plans to launch a store-within-a-store strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • RTW

    New York & Co. (NWY -14.9%), which plunged on Friday after missing Q2 revenue forecasts, is...

    New York & Co. (NWY -14.9%), which plunged on Friday after missing Q2 revenue forecasts, is falling again today on a downgrade to Neutral from Piper Jaffray. Piper thinks the weakness in the company's casual apparel offerings is "unlikely to show much improvement until spring 2012."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • KNX

    Swift Transportation (SWFT +5%) is trading higher on an upgrade to Buy on valuation from...

    Swift Transportation (SWFT +5%) is trading higher on an upgrade to Buy on valuation from Capstone. The firm says the trucking company is showing improved execution in most areas, particularly with regards to pricing and growth in loaded miles.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +5.2%) pops this morning after its board authorizes the repurchase of up to 500K...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +5.2%) pops this morning after its board authorizes the repurchase of up to 500K common shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • PTRY

    Pantry Inc. (PTRY -2.7%) trades lower this morning after announcing the resignation of its CEO,...

    Pantry Inc. (PTRY -2.7%) trades lower this morning after announcing the resignation of its CEO, Terrance M. Marks, for personal reasons.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • SBUX

    A survey of large coffee-producing countries indicates this year's harvest could be the largest...

    A survey of large coffee-producing countries indicates this year's harvest could be the largest in 3 years, and push prices lower. Industry insiders attribute the improved yield to better farming practices and coordinated programs. Coffee stocks: SBUX +2.5%, GMCR +6%, PEET +1.8%, JVA +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -1.6%) turns red after opening 3% higher. The stock is now at $6.86 - the...

    Bank of America (BAC -1.6%) turns red after opening 3% higher. The stock is now at $6.86 - the low close during this month's sell-off is $6.51. The XLF is clinging to gains, +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • NDN

    99 Cents (NYSE:NDN) +9.8% at 18.17 after a report that Apollo (NYSE:APO) is preparing a bid to...

    99 Cents (NYSE:NDN) +9.8% at 18.17 after a report that Apollo (NYSE:APO) is preparing a bid to acquire the deep-discount chain. The founding family already had a deal to take 99 Cents private in partnership with Leonard Green for $19.09 a share, or $1.3B, but will now support the highest bidder.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks are early outperformers, paced by Melco Crown (MPEL +3.7%). Gainers: LVS +2.1%,...

    Casino stocks are early outperformers, paced by Melco Crown (MPEL +3.7%). Gainers: LVS +2.1%, PENN +2.9%, MGM +2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • VLTC

    Mobile advertising firm Motricity (MOTR) is up 4.5% after announcing it has fired CEO Ryan...

    Mobile advertising firm Motricity (MOTR) is up 4.5% after announcing it has fired CEO Ryan Wuerch, and appointed COO Jim Smith to be its interim CEO. Motricity shares were clobbered earlier this month on account of the company's dismal Q2 results and Q3 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • TUDO

    Though Chinese video site Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) fell 33% last week following its Wednesday IPO,...

    Though Chinese video site Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) fell 33% last week following its Wednesday IPO, shares are up 7.9% today on a report Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) has made an investment of $30M-$40M in the company, giving it a stake of roughly 4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • QUBSF

    Shares of AMR are soaring 7.6% premarket, riding higher with other airline stocks...

    Shares of AMR are soaring 7.6% premarket, riding higher with other airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA). The firm looks to get a boost after Qantas (OTCPK:QUBSF) says it has received approval from a consumer regulator to work together with AMR on trans-Pacific flights.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • YGE

    Though Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) fell on Friday after reporting Q2 results, Piper Jaffray...

    Though Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) fell on Friday after reporting Q2 results, Piper Jaffray (Outperform) and Avian (Positive) are upgrading shares today. Piper is pleased with how Yingli outperformed many rivals in Q2, while Avian is bullish on a combination of seasonal demand and growing market penetration. YGE +9.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • YGE

    Premarket gainers: YGE +10%. CLWR +10%. IRE +7%. AMR +6%. SNY +5%. RCL +5%. TOT +5%. HMY +5%....

    Premarket gainers: YGE +10%. CLWR +10%. IRE +7%. AMR +6%. SNY +5%. RCL +5%. TOT +5%. HMY +5%. LVLT +5%. SODA +5%. GSK +5%. RDS.A +5%. LDK +6%. SGEN +6%. AA +4%. MCP +4%. MPEL +4%. AZN +4%. MGM +4%. UN +4%. FTE +4%. RF +4%. RENN +4%. KCI +4%. MT +4%. MOTR +4%. SAP +4%. NVS +4%. F +4%. HAL +3%. CAT +2%. AKS +3%. BIDU +3%. EK +3%. DRYS +3%. LOW +3%.
    Losers: RBS -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • ANN

    Goldman Sachs lowers its PT on shares of AnnTaylor (NYSE:ANN) to $25 from $27, and keeps a...

    Goldman Sachs lowers its PT on shares of AnnTaylor (NYSE:ANN) to $25 from $27, and keeps a Neutral rating in place. Shares are undeterred, up 3.3% premarket after registering a 12.6% gain on Friday following its earnings beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • F

    Shares of Ford (NYSE:F) are 3.5% higher premarket in advance of a product announcement scheduled...

    Shares of Ford (NYSE:F) are 3.5% higher premarket in advance of a product announcement scheduled for 10:00 AM.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) catches an upgrade from Davenport to Buy from Hold with a $18 price target....

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) catches an upgrade from Davenport to Buy from Hold with a $18 price target. Higher aluminum prices could boost the firm's metal segments, says an analyst. Shares +2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • E

    One of the top gainers in Europe is Italian oil major Eni (NYSE:E), Libya's largest foreign oil...

    One of the top gainers in Europe is Italian oil major Eni (NYSE:E), Libya's largest foreign oil investor. Officials from the company are back in Libya, looking into restarting facilities. The company expects 2-3 months to restart gas production, and one year for oil. Shares +7.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian shares are mostly lower on concerns about the U.S. economy, with Friday's fall on Wall...

    Asian shares are mostly lower on concerns about the U.S. economy, with Friday's fall on Wall Street dampening demand. Japan -1%, Hong Kong -0.9%, China -0.7%, India +0.2%. Spot gold hits another fresh high of $1894.30/oz.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 AM
